headline: Textron Q2 Earnings Surpass Estimates, Revenues Improve Y/Y
summary: Textron posts a Q2 earnings beat as revenues rise 5.4% Y/Y. The company reiterates its 2025 EPS estimate.

headline: Aircraft maker Textron tops profit estimates on strong aftermarket service, Bell demand
summary: "In the quarter, we saw revenue growth in both our commercial aircraft and helicopter businesses, as well as in Bell's FLRAA program, now known as the MV-75," said Textron Chairman and CEO Scott C. Donnelly.  Textron's larger aviation segment, which manufactures Cessna and Beechcraft aircraft, delivered 49 jets in the quarter, up from 42 in the second quarter last year.  The segment's revenue rose 2.9% from last year to $1.52 billion, aided by higher aftermarket parts and services revenues in the second quarter.

headline: Textron (TXT) Q2 Earnings and Revenues Surpass Estimates
summary: Textron (TXT) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +6.90% and +2.37%, respectively, for the quarter ended June 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Textron (NYSE:TXT) Beats Q2 Sales Targets
summary: Aerospace and defense company Textron (NYSE:TXT) reported Q2 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 5.4% year on year to $3.72 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.55 per share was 7.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Textron (NYSE:TXT) Beats Q2 Sales Targets

headline: Textron Reports Second Quarter 2025 Results
summary: PROVIDENCE, R.I., July 24, 2025--Textron Inc. (NYSE: TXT) today reported second quarter 2025 income from continuing operations of $1.35 per share, flat with the second quarter of 2024. Adjusted income from continuing operations, a non-GAAP measure that is defined and reconciled to GAAP in an attachment to this release, was $1.55 per share for the second quarter of 2025, compared to $1.54 per share in the second quarter of 2024.
